item.title: Jean-Marie Le Pen, Rabble-Rousing Leader of French Far Right, Dies at 96
item.description: He ran unsuccessfully for the French presidency five times, riding waves of discontent and xenophobia as the leader of the National Front party.

item.title: Educators Prepare for ICE Agents at the Schoolhouse Door
item.description: Across the country, educators described widespread anxiety about President-elect Donald J. Trump’s promises to deport immigrants and what it could mea...

item.title: Drug Company to Share Revenues With Indigenous People Who Donated Their Genes
item.description: Variant Bio, a small biotech company based in Seattle, is using genetic information from Indigenous people to develop drugs for obesity and diabetes.

item.title: The Next Congress
item.description: We explore the disagreements that could define the new Congress — and potentially derail Donald Trump’s agenda.

item.title: 7.1-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes China’s Tibet Region Near Nepal Border
item.description: Chinese state media said at least 95 people had died in the 7.1-magnitude quake near one of Tibet’s holiest cities. It was felt in neighboring Nepal.
